Promote suffix to own extraction group

Source: R/mode_of_sep.R
suffix_to_keywords.Rd

Promotes suffix.class + suffix pair -> title + keywords, as in For each record, this becomes a whole new mapping, (ie if you have a list of contextractr::Contextractr mappings, each mapping becomes a list of mappings, and to give them to a contextractr::Contextractr$new() call, you would index into a top level element and give it that.

suffix_to_keywords(grouping_map)

Arguments

grouping_map

a contextractr::Contextractr$add_serial() compatible list

Value

the grouping_map, but each group element is replaced with a list of groups built from its subelements, changing: * suffix -> keyword * suffix.class -> title

Details

Helper function for encounter transforms until suffix extraction is
implemented on contextractr.

Examples

mapping <- list(
  death = list(title = "death",
    keywords = c("death", "dead", "died", "deceased"),
    suffix = c("with Autopsy", "without Autopsy"),
    suffix.class = c("with autopsy", "without autopsy")),
  transfer = list(
    title = "transfer",
    keywords = c("trans", "transfer"),
    suffix = c("Nurs.*Home", "Psych", "hopsital"),
    suffix.class = c("RACF", "psychiatric", "hospital")))

out <- mapping %>% suffix_to_keywords()

#> Error in mapping %>% suffix_to_keywords(): could not find function "%>%"

out %>% yaml::as_yaml() %>% cat()

#> Error in out %>% yaml::as_yaml() %>% cat(): could not find function "%>%"

if (FALSE) {
ctx <- contextractr::Contextractr$new(serial = out$death)

df <- fake_df()
df %<>% ctx$locate_keywords(fake_col)
}
